params.name: $DETAILBLENDMODE
params.desc: mode for combining detail texture with base. 0=normal, 1= additive, 2=alpha blend detail over base, 3=crossfade

params.name: $DETAILBLENDFACTOR2
params.desc: blend amount for detail texture on texture 2.

params.name: $DETAILBLENDFACTOR3
params.desc: blend amount for detail texture on texture 3.

params.name: $DETAILBLENDFACTOR4
params.desc: blend amount for detail texture on texture 4.

params.name: $NODIFFUSEBUMPLIGHTING
params.desc: 0 == Use diffuse bump lighting, 1 = No diffuse bump lighting

params.name: $TEXTURE1_LUMSTART
params.desc: texture 1 start component for lum smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE1_LUMEND
params.desc: texture 1 end component for lum smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE2_BLENDSTART
params.desc: texture 2 start component for blend smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE2_BLENDEND
params.desc: texture 2 end component for blend smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE2_LUMSTART
params.desc: texture 2 start component for lum smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE2_LUMEND
params.desc: texture 2 end component for lum smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE2_BUMPBLENDFACTOR
params.desc: texture 2 how much the bump blends in (ignored if bumpmap2 exists)

params.name: $TEXTURE3_BLENDSTART
params.desc: texture 3 start component for blend smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE3_BLENDEND
params.desc: texture 3 end component for blend smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE3_LUMSTART
params.desc: texture 3 start component for lum smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE3_LUMEND
params.desc: texture 3 end component for lum smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE3_BUMPBLENDFACTOR
params.desc: texture 3 how much the bump blends in

params.name: $TEXTURE4_BLENDSTART
params.desc: texture 4 start component for blend smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE4_BLENDEND
params.desc: texture 4 end component for blend smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE4_LUMSTART
params.desc: texture 4 start component for lum smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE4_LUMEND
params.desc: texture 4 end component for lum smoothstep

params.name: $TEXTURE4_BUMPBLENDFACTOR
params.desc: texture 4 how much the bump blends in

params.name: $SSBUMP
params.desc: whether or not to use alternate bumpmap format with height

params.name: $BUMP_FORCE_ON
params.desc: force bump-mapping on, even for low-end machines

params.name: $SEAMLESS_SCALE
params.desc: Scale factor for 'seamless' texture mapping. 0 means to use ordinary mapping

params.name: $LUMBLENDFACTOR2
params.desc: blend factor between the luminance of layer 2 and layer one

params.name: $LUMBLENDFACTOR3
params.desc: blend factor between the luminance of layer 3 and layers below it

params.name: $LUMBLENDFACTOR4
params.desc: blend factor between the luminance of layer 4 and layers below it

params.name: $ENVMAPANISOTROPY
params.desc: Enable anisotropic cubemap lookups for macroscopically rough/microscopically smooth surfaces, like wet asphalt

params.name: $ENVMAPANISOTROPYSCALE
params.desc: Scale anisotropy amount for cubemap lookups

params.name: $ENVMAPLIGHTSCALE
params.desc: How much the lightmap effects environment map reflection, 0.0 is off, 1.0 will allow complete blackness of the environment map if the lightmap is black

params.name: $ENVMAPLIGHTSCALEMINMAX
params.desc: Thresholds for the lightmap envmap effect.  Setting the min higher increases the minimum light amount at which the envmap gets nerfed to nothing.

params.name: $basetexture
params.desc: Base Texture with lighting built in

params.name: $srgbtint
params.desc: tint value to be applied when running on new-style srgb parts

params.name: $DETAILBLENDMODE
params.desc: mode for combining detail texture with base. 0=normal, 1= additive, 2=alpha blend detail over base, 3=crossfade

params.name: $NODIFFUSEBUMPLIGHTING
params.desc: 0 == Use diffuse bump lighting, 1 = No diffuse bump lighting

params.name: $BLENDMODULATETEXTURE
params.desc: texture to use r/g channels for blend range for

params.name: $SSBUMP
params.desc: whether or not to use alternate bumpmap format with height

params.name: $BUMP_FORCE_ON
params.desc: force bump-mapping on, even for low-end machines

params.name: $SEAMLESS_SCALE
params.desc: Scale factor for 'seamless' texture mapping. 0 means to use ordinary mapping

params.name: $ENVMAPANISOTROPY
params.desc: Enable anisotropic cubemap lookups for macroscopically rough/microscopically smooth surfaces, like wet asphalt

params.name: $ENVMAPANISOTROPYSCALE
params.desc: Scale anisotropy amount for cubemap lookups

params.name: $NOENVMAPMIP
params.desc: Force envmap lookup to always use the top-level mip map

params.name: $ADDBUMPMAPS
params.desc: Add bump map 1 and 2 together, renormalize

params.name: $SHADERSRGBREAD360
params.desc: Simulate srgb read in shader code

params.name: $ENVMAPLIGHTSCALE
params.desc: How much the lightmap effects environment map reflection, 0.0 is off, 1.0 will allow complete blackness of the environment map if the lightmap is black

params.name: $ENVMAPLIGHTSCALEMINMAX
params.desc: Thresholds for the lightmap envmap effect.  Setting the min higher increases the minimum light amount at which the envmap gets nerfed to nothing.

params.name: $PAINTSPLATNORMALMAP
params.desc: The paint splat normal map to use when paint is enabled on the surface

params.name: $PAINTSPLATBUBBLELAYOUT
params.desc: The layout texture which defines the distribution of bubbles in the paint

params.name: $PAINTSPLATBUBBLE
params.desc: The normal mapped texture of a single bubble

params.name: $PAINTENVMAP
params.desc: Envmap that is consistent across all surfaces

params.name: $PHONGEXPONENT
params.desc: Phong exponent for Key (CSM Casting) Light - on $basetexture

params.name: $PHONGEXPONENT2
params.desc: Phong exponent for Key (CSM Casting) Light - on $basetexture2

params.name: $PHONGMASKCONTRASTBRIGHTNESS
params.desc: Contrast and Brightness for Phong Mask generation using $basetexture

params.name: $PHONGMASKCONTRASTBRIGHTNESS2
params.desc: Contrast and Brightness for Phong Mask generation using $basetexture2

params.name: $PHONGAMOUNT
params.desc: Phong tint and amount on $basetexture > 1 to scale phong, .a is diffuseComponent multiplier, 0=> remove diffuse, >1 => overbright diffuse

params.name: $PHONGAMOUNT2
params.desc: Phong tint and amount on $basetexture2 > 1 to scale phong, .a is diffuseComponent multiplier, 0=> remove diffuse, >1 => overbright diffuse

params.name: $ENVMAPORIGIN
params.desc: The world space position of the env_cubemap being corrected

params.desc: Texture with metalness in R, roughness in G, ambient occlusion in B.

params.name: $PARALLAXCENTER
params.desc: Center depth of the Parallax Map

params.name: $MRAOSCALE
params.desc: Factors for metalness, roughness, and ambient occlusion

params.name: $EMISSIONSCALE
params.desc: Color to multiply emission texture with

params.name: $EMISSIONSCALE2
params.desc: Color to multiply emission texture with

params.name: $HSV

params.name: $HSV_BLEND
params.desc: Blend untransformed color and HSV transformed color

params.desc: The world space position of the env_cubemap being corrected

params.name: $BLENDTINTBYMRAOALPHA
params.desc: Blend tint by the alpha channel in MRAO texture. Similar to $blendtintbybasealpha for VLG

params.desc: When enabled, apply dithering to parallax to improve quality

params.name: $PARALLAXSCALE
params.desc: Multiply the number of parallax samples by this amount. DANGER: This can be EXPENSIVE!

params.desc: scale detail1 as multiplier of base UVs

params.name: $TANGENTTOPACITYRANGES
params.desc: enables view-based opacity falloff based on tangent t direction, great for cylinders, includes last term for scaling backface opacity

params.name: $TANGENTSOPACITYRANGES
params.desc: enables view-based opacity falloff based on tangent s direction, great for cylinders, includes last term for scaling backface opacity

params.name: $FRESNELOPACITYRANGES
params.desc: enables fresnel-based opacity falloff, includes last term for scaling backface opacity

params.name: $NEEDSTANGENTT
params.desc: don't need to set this explicitly, it gets set when tangenttopacityranges is defined

params.name: $NEEDSTANGENTS
params.desc: don't need to set this explicitly, it gets set when tangentSopacityranges is defined

params.name: $NEEDSNORMALS
params.desc: don't need to set this explicitly, it gets set when fresnelopacityranges is defined

params.name: $DEPTHBLENDSCALE
params.desc: Amplify or reduce DEPTHBLEND fading. Lower values make harder edges.

params.name: $REFRACT
params.desc: Enable refraction when flowmap is specified

params.name: $REFRACTEFFECTSCALE
params.desc: Apply this boost to the rgb channel of the fizzler effects when refract is enabled

params.name: $basetexture
params.desc: Base Texture with lighting built in

params.name: $srgbtint
params.desc: tint value to be applied when running on new-style srgb parts

params.name: $SHADERSRGBREAD360
params.desc: Simulate srgb read in shader code

params.name: $SHADOWDEPTH
params.desc: writing to a shadow depth buffer

params.name: $basetexture
params.desc: Base Texture with lighting built in

params.name: $srgbtint
params.desc: tint value to be applied when running on new-style srgb parts

params.name: $NOSRGB
params.desc: do not operate in srgb space

params.name: $basetexture
params.desc: Base Texture with lighting built in

params.name: $srgbtint
params.desc: tint value to be applied when running on new-style srgb parts

params.name: $DEPTHBLENDSCALE
params.desc: Amplify or reduce DEPTHBLEND fading. Lower values make harder edges.

params.name: $INVERSEDEPTHBLEND
params.desc: calculate 1-depthblendalpha so that sprites appear when they are near geometry

params.name: $ORIENTATION
params.desc: 0 = always face camera, 1 = rotate around z, 2= parallel to ground 3=use normal 4=face camera POS

params.name: $AIMATCAMERA
params.desc: Aim at camera using orientation type 1

params.name: $ADDBASETEXTURE2
params.desc: amount to blend second texture into frame by

params.name: $OVERBRIGHTFACTOR
params.desc: overbright factor for texture. For HDR effects.

params.name: $SEQUENCE_BLEND_MODE
params.desc: defines the blend mode between the images un dual sequence particles. 0 = avg, 1=alpha from first, rgb from 2nd, 2= first over second

params.name: $MAXLUMFRAMEBLEND1
params.desc: instead of blending between animation frames for the first sequence, select pixels based upon max luminance

params.name: $MAXLUMFRAMEBLEND2
params.desc: instead of blending between animation frames for the 2nd sequence, select pixels based upon max luminance

params.name: $RAMPTEXTURE
params.desc: if specified, then the red value of the image is used to index this ramp to produce the output color

params.name: $ZOOMANIMATESEQ2
params.desc: amount to gradually zoom between frames on the second sequence. 2.0 will double the size of a frame over its lifetime.

params.name: $EXTRACTGREENALPHA
params.desc: grayscale data sitting in green/alpha channels

params.name: $ADDSELF
params.desc: amount of base texture to additively blend in

params.name: $BLENDFRAMES
params.desc: whether or not to smoothly blend between animated frames

params.name: $MINSIZE
params.desc: minimum screen fractional size of particle

params.name: $STARTFADESIZE
params.desc: screen fractional size to start fading particle out

params.name: $ENDFADESIZE
params.desc: screen fractional size to finish fading particle out

params.name: $MAXSIZE
params.desc: maximum screen fractional size of particle

params.name: $USEINSTANCING
params.desc: whether to use GPU vertex instancing (submit 1 vert per particle quad)

params.name: $MAXDISTANCE
params.desc: maximum distance to draw particles at

params.name: $FARFADEINTERVAL
params.desc: interval over which to fade out far away particles

params.name: $SHADERSRGBREAD360
params.desc: Simulate srgb read in shader code

params.name: $ORIENTATIONMATRIX
params.desc: Matrix used to orient in orientation mode #2

params.name: $MOD2X
params.desc: whether or not to multiply the result of the pixel shader * 2 against the framebuffer

params.name: $ALPHATRAILFADE
params.desc: Amount to scale alpha by between start and end of trail/rope

params.name: $RADIUSTRAILFADE
params.desc: Amount to scale radis by between start and end of trail/rope

params.name: $SHADOWDEPTH
params.desc: writing to a shadow depth buffer

params.name: $CROPFACTOR
params.desc: writing to a shadow depth buffer

params.name: $VERTEXCOLORLERP
params.desc: Enable computing vertex color by interpolating two color based on vertex r color channel

params.name: $VERTEXFOGAMOUNT
params.desc: Amount of vertex fog to apply

params.name: $DISTANCEALPHA
params.desc: Use distance-coded alpha generated from hi-res texture by vtex.

params.name: $SOFTEDGES
params.desc: Enable soft edges to distance coded textures.

params.name: $EDGESOFTNESSSTART
params.desc: Start value for soft edges for distancealpha.

params.name: $EDGESOFTNESSEND
params.desc: End value for soft edges for distancealpha.

params.name: $OUTLINE
params.desc: Enable outline for distance coded textures.

params.name: $OUTLINECOLOR
params.desc: color of outline for distance coded images.

params.name: $MULOUTPUTBYALPHA
params.desc: Multiply output RGB by output alpha to avoid precision problems

params.name: $INTENSITY
params.desc: Multiply output RGB by intensity factor

params.name: $basetexture
params.desc: Base Texture with lighting built in

params.name: $srgbtint
params.desc: tint value to be applied when running on new-style srgb parts

params.name: $ILLUMFACTOR
params.desc: Amount to darken or brighten the teeth

params.name: $FORWARD
params.desc: Forward direction vector for teeth lighting

params.name: $ENTITYORIGIN
params.desc: center if the model in world space

params.name: $basetexture
params.desc: Base Texture with lighting built in

params.name: $srgbtint
params.desc: tint value to be applied when running on new-style srgb parts

params.name: $ALBEDO
params.desc: albedo (Base texture with no baked lighting)

params.name: $PHONGEXPONENT
params.desc: Phong exponent for local specular lights

params.name: $PHONGTINT
params.desc: Phong tint for local specular lights

params.name: $PHONGALBEDOTINT
params.desc: Apply tint by albedo (controlled by spec exponent texture

params.name: $LIGHTWARPTEXTURE
params.desc: 1D ramp texture for tinting scalar diffuse term

params.name: $PHONGBOOST
params.desc: Phong overbrightening factor (specular mask channel should be authored to account for this)

params.name: $DETAILBLENDMODE
params.desc: mode for combining detail texture with base. 0=normal, 1= additive, 2=alpha blend detail over base, 3=crossfade

params.name: $DECALBLENDMODE
params.desc: mode for combining decal texture with base. 0=normal(decal*srca + base*(1-srca), 1= mod, 2=mod2x, 3=additive

params.name: $DISTANCEALPHA
params.desc: Use distance-coded alpha generated from hi-res texture by vtex.

params.name: $DISTANCEALPHAFROMDETAIL
params.desc: Take the distance-coded alpha mask from the detail texture.

params.name: $SOFTEDGES
params.desc: Enable soft edges to distance coded textures.

params.name: $SCALEEDGESOFTNESSBASEDONSCREENRES
params.desc: Scale the size of the soft edges based upon resolution. 1024x768 = nominal.

params.name: $EDGESOFTNESSSTART
params.desc: Start value for soft edges for distancealpha.

params.name: $EDGESOFTNESSEND
params.desc: End value for soft edges for distancealpha.

params.name: $GLOW
params.desc: Enable glow/shadow for distance coded textures.

params.name: $GLOWCOLOR
params.desc: color of outter glow for distance coded line art.

params.name: $GLOWALPHA
params.desc: Base glow alpha amount for glows/shadows with distance alpha.

params.name: $GLOWX
params.desc: texture offset x for glow mask.

params.name: $GLOWY
params.desc: texture offset y for glow mask.

params.name: $OUTLINE
params.desc: Enable outline for distance coded textures.

params.name: $OUTLINECOLOR
params.desc: color of outline for distance coded images.

params.name: $SCALEOUTLINESOFTNESSBASEDONSCREENRES
params.desc: Scale the size of the soft part of the outline based upon resolution. 1024x768 = nominal.

params.name: $GAMMACOLORREAD
params.desc: Disables SRGB conversion of color texture read.

params.name: $LINEARWRITE
params.desc: Disables SRGB conversion of shader results.

params.name: $RECEIVEFLASHLIGHT
params.desc: Forces this material to receive flashlights.

params.name: $SINGLEPASSFLASHLIGHT
params.desc: Flags this material as possibly being run through single pass flashlight code

params.name: $SHADERSRGBREAD360
params.desc: Simulate srgb read in shader code

params.name: $TINTMASKTEXTURE
params.desc: Separate tint mask texture (as opposed to using basetexture alpha)

params.desc: Base Texture with lighting built in

params.name: $srgbtint
params.desc: tint value to be applied when running on new-style srgb parts

params.name: $CLOAKPASSENABLED
params.desc: Enables cloak render in a second pass

params.name: $basetexture
params.desc: Base Texture with lighting built in

params.name: $srgbtint
params.desc: tint value to be applied when running on new-style srgb parts

params.name: $ALBEDO
params.desc: albedo (Base texture with no baked lighting)

params.name: $SELFILLUM_ENVMAPMASK_ALPHA
params.desc: defines that self illum value comes from env map mask alpha

params.name: $SELFILLUMFRESNELMINMAXEXP
params.desc: Self illum fresnel min, max, exp

params.name: $PHONGEXPONENT
params.desc: Phong exponent for local specular lights

params.name: $PHONGTINT
params.desc: Phong tint for local specular lights

params.name: $PHONGALBEDOTINT
params.desc: Apply tint by albedo (controlled by spec exponent texture

params.name: $LIGHTWARPTEXTURE
params.desc: 1D ramp texture for tinting scalar diffuse term

params.name: $PHONGBOOST
params.desc: Phong overbrightening factor (specular mask channel should be authored to account for this)

params.name: $PHONGALBEDOBOOST
params.desc: Phong albedo overbrightening factor (specular mask channel should be authored to account for this)

params.name: $FORCEPHONG
params.desc: forces Phong lighting, even at low GPU levels (Phong must already be enabled)

params.name: $BASEMAPALPHAPHONGMASK
params.desc: indicates that there is no normal map and that the phong mask is in base alpha

params.name: $INVERTPHONGMASK
params.desc: invert the phong mask (0=full phong, 1=no phong)

params.name: $ENVMAPFRESNEL
params.desc: Degree to which Fresnel should be applied to env map

params.name: $SELFILLUMMASK
params.desc: If we bind a texture here, it overrides base alpha (if any) for self illum

params.name: $BASEMAPLUMINANCEPHONGMASK
params.desc: indicates that the base luminance should be used to mask phong

params.name: $DETAILBLENDMODE
params.desc: mode for combining detail texture with base. 0=normal, 1= additive, 2=alpha blend detail over base, 3=crossfade

params.name: $RIMMASK
params.desc: Indicates whether or not to use alpha channel of exponent texture to mask the rim term

params.name: $SEAMLESS_BASE
params.desc: whether to apply seamless mapping to the base texture. requires a smooth model.

params.name: $SEAMLESS_DETAIL
params.desc: where to apply seamless mapping to the detail texture.

params.name: $SEAMLESS_SCALE
params.desc: the scale for the seamless mapping. # of repetions of texture per inch.

params.name: $CLOAKPASSENABLED
params.desc: Enables cloak render in a second pass

params.name: $FLESHBORDERNOISESCALE
params.desc: Flesh Noise UV scalar for border

params.name: $LINEARWRITE
params.desc: Disables SRGB conversion of shader results.

params.name: $SHADERSRGBREAD360
params.desc: Simulate srgb read in shader code

params.name: $AMBIENTOCCLUSION
params.desc: Amount of screen space ambient occlusion to use (0..1 range)

params.name: $BLENDTINTBYBASEALPHA
params.desc: Use the base alpha to blend in the $color modulation

params.name: $DESATURATEWITHBASEALPHA
params.desc: Use the base alpha to desaturate the base texture.  Set to non-zero to enable, value gets multiplied into the alpha channel before desaturating.

params.name: $ENVMAPFRESNELMINMAXEXP
params.desc: Min/max fresnel range and exponent for vertexlitgeneric

params.name: $DECALBLENDMODE
params.desc: mode for combining decal texture with base. 0=normal(decal*srca + base*(1-srca), 1= mod, 2=mod2x, 3=additive

params.name: $ENVMAPLIGHTSCALE
params.desc: How much the lightmap effects environment map reflection, 0.0 is off, 1.0 will allow complete blackness of the environment map if the lightmap is black

params.name: $ENVMAPLIGHTSCALEMINMAX
params.desc: Thresholds for the lightmap envmap effect.  Setting the min higher increases the minimum light amount at which the envmap gets nerfed to nothing.

params.name: $TINTMASKTEXTURE
params.desc: Separate tint mask texture (as opposed to using basetexture alpha)

params.name: $ENVMAPMASKINTINTMASKTEXTURE
params.desc: Envmap mask is stored in ting mask texture (instead of normal map alpha)

params.name: $LAYEREDDAMAGEBLEND
params.desc: When enabled, blend mode 4 turns into a special blend mode for layering damage, with the detail texture being the lower strata with no spec or env, and the base texture being the upper strata which casts a drop shadow.  The blend is a thresholded value based on the detail alpha, allowing for what looks like chipped off paint or cracks.

params.name: $NODIFFUSEBUMPLIGHTING

params.name: $DETAILBLENDMODE
params.desc: mode for combining detail texture with base. 0=normal, 1= additive, 2=alpha blend detail over base, 3=crossfade

params.name: $BLENDMODULATETEXTURE
params.desc: texture to use r/g channels for blend range for

params.name: $SSBUMP
params.desc: whether or not to use alternate bumpmap format with height

params.name: $BUMP_FORCE_ON
params.desc: force bump-mapping on, even for low-end machines

params.name: $SEAMLESS_SCALE
params.desc: Scale factor for 'seamless' texture mapping. 0 means to use ordinary mapping

params.name: $ENVMAPANISOTROPY
params.desc: Enable anisotropic cubemap lookups for macroscopically rough/microscopically smooth surfaces, like wet asphalt

params.name: $ENVMAPANISOTROPYSCALE
params.desc: Scale anisotropy amount for cubemap lookups

params.name: $ENVMAPLIGHTSCALE
params.desc: How much the lightmap effects environment map reflection, 0.0 is off, 1.0 will allow complete blackness of the environment map if the lightmap is black

params.name: $ENVMAPLIGHTSCALEMINMAX
params.desc: Thresholds for the lightmap envmap effect.  Setting the min higher increases the minimum light amount at which the envmap gets nerfed to nothing.

params.name: $PHONGEXPONENT
params.desc: Phong exponent for Key (CSM Casting) Light - on $basetexture

params.name: $PHONGEXPONENT2
params.desc: Phong exponent for Key (CSM Casting) Light - on $basetexture2

params.name: $PHONGMASKCONTRASTBRIGHTNESS
params.desc: Contrast and Brightness for Phong Mask generation using $basetexture

params.name: $PHONGMASKCONTRASTBRIGHTNESS2
params.desc: Contrast and Brightness for Phong Mask generation using $basetexture2

params.name: $PHONGAMOUNT
params.desc: Phong tint and amount on $basetexture > 1 to scale phong, .a is diffuseComponent multiplier, 0=> remove diffuse, >1 => overbright diffuse

params.name: $PHONGAMOUNT2
params.desc: Phong tint and amount on $basetexture2 > 1 to scale phong, .a is diffuseComponent multiplier, 0=> remove diffuse, >1 => overbright diffuse

params.name: $DROPSHADOWHIGHLIGHTSCALE
params.desc: Highlight size opposite drop shadow effect

params.name: $ENVMAPORIGIN
params.desc: The world space position of the env_cubemap being corrected
